sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using Gaussian elimination
message_1:
Solve the following system of linear equations using Gaussian Elimination:

3x + 2y - 4z = 10
2x - 3y + z = -8
-x + 5y - 2z = 4
message_2:
First, we will write the augmented matrix for the given system of linear equations:

|  3   2  -4 |  10 |
|  2  -3   1 |  -8 |
| -1   5  -2 |   4 |

Step 1: Swap Row 1 and Row 3 to have a non-zero element in the first position:

| -1   5  -2 |   4 |
|  2  -3   1 |  -8 |
|  3   2  -4 |  10 |

Step 2: Add 2 times Row 1 to Row 2 and 3 times Row 1 to Row 3 to eliminate the first element in Row 2 and Row 3:

| -1   5  -2 |   4 |
|  0  -1   3 |   0 |
|  0  17 -10 |  22 |

Step 3: Multiply Row 2 by -1 to have a non-zero element in the second position of Row 2:

| -1   5  -2 |   4 |
|  0   1  -3 |   0 |
|  0  17 -10 |  22 |

Step 4: Subtract 17 times Row 2 from Row 3 to eliminate the second element in Row 3:

| -1   5  -2 |   4 |
|  0   1  -3 |   0 |
|  0   0   41 |  22 |

Step 5: Divide Row 3 by 41 to have a non-zero element in the third position of Row 3:

| -1   5  -2 |   4 |
|  0   1  -3 |   0 |
|  0   0   1 |  22/41 |

Now, we have the matrix in row-echelon form. We will use back-substitution to find the solution.

Step 6: Add 3 times Row 3 to Row 2 and 2 times Row 3 to Row 1:

| -1   5   0 |  132/41 |
|  0   1   0 |  66/41  |
|  0   0   1 |  22/41  |

Step 7: Subtract 5 times Row 2 from Row 1:

| -1   0   0 |  2/41   |
|  0   1   0 |  66/41  |
|  0   0   1 |  22/41  |

Step 8: Multiply Row 1 by -1:

|  1   0   0 | -2/41   |
|  0   1   0 |  66/41  |
|  0   0   1 |  22/41  |

The solution to the system of linear equations is:

x = -2/41
y = 66/41
z = 22/41
